scheduler.generate
Class Schedule

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      scheduler.generate.Schedule
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Schedule
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.io.Serializable

Contains the methods for generating a schedule. See method documentation for the details behind this process.

Author:
Eric Liebowitz
See Also:

Method Detail

generate

public void generate(java.util.Vector<Course> cdb,
                     java.util.Vector<Instructor> idb,
                     java.util.Vector<Location> ldb,
                     java.util.Vector<SchedulePreference> pdb,
                     Progress p)
 Generates a schedule. In particular, the process adheres to the process 
 outlined in the pseudo code below:

    while (there are courses)
       get Insructor "i"
       choose Course "c" which "i" most wants to teach
       choose a time "t" when "i" most wants to teach
       choose a location "l" which can accomodate "c" and "t"

 This method calls the "gen" method to do most the heavy lifting for
 generation. However, most, if not all of the exception handling is done
 here.

 However, before generation begins, any/all "locked" ScheduleItems from the
 previous schedule are immediately added to the new Schedule.

Parameters:
cdb - The list of courses to schedule
idb - The list of instructors with which to teach the courses
ldb - The list of location in which to teach the courses
pdb - The list of schedule preferences to be incorporated in the schedule
p - SwingWorker used to display scheduling progress to the user

compileLockedItems

private void compileLockedItems()
Goes through the current schedule and puts all the "locked" ScheduleItems into "lockedItems", keyed by the courses they contain. The previous list of lockedItems is reset here.

reset

private void reset()
Resets (clears) all data particular to the schedule. Note that "lockedItems" is not reset here. Since this piece of data needs the old Schedule's locked items prior to generation, it will have been created before this method is called (as the old schedule is wiped here). So, I shouldn't go wiping it out just after I made it.

initBookings

private void initBookings(java.util.Vector<Instructor> idb,
                          java.util.Vector<Location> ldb,
                          java.util.Vector<SchedulePreference> pdb)
Initializes the l and i bookings HashMaps to contain fresh WeekAvail objects for each item in the cdb, ldb, and idb (respectively). It'll also create Treatment objects for each Instructor while it's at it. Also inits the "cOverlaps" variable, which keeps track of what classes can/can't overlap one another.

Parameters:
idb - List of instructors for generating
ldb - List of locations for generating
pdb - List of SchedulePreferences to apply to the schedule (currently, should only be NCO's)

initSchedule

private void initSchedule()
Fills the schedule with whatever ScheduleItems are currently values in the "lockedItems" LinkedHashMap

gen

private Course gen(Instructor i,
                   java.util.Vector<Course> cdb,
                   java.util.Vector<Instructor> idb,
                   java.util.Vector<Location> ldb,
                   java.util.Vector<SchedulePreference> pdb)
            throws EmptyCourseDatabaseException,
                   InstructorCanTeachNothingException,
                   InstructorWTUMaxedException,
                   InstructorNotInDatabaseException,
                   NullInstructorException,
                   CouldNotBeScheduledException
 Does the heavy lifting for schedule generation. 
 
 Given an instructor, it selects a course for him/her to teach. 
 
 It subsequently gathers a list of all possible days/time combinations, 
 in descending order of desirability. 
 
 With this information, it will compile a list of all locations which can
 be taught on any of those day/time combinations, in descending order of
 desirability.
 
 All this information will culminate in the course being scheduled. The 
 course's section count will be decremented by one and, if it has a lab
 which was also scheduled, the lab's will be decremented as well.

Parameters:
i - The given Instructor
cdb - List of courses still available to teach
idb - List of all Instructor still able to teach
ldb - List of all Locations
pdb - List of all SchedulePreferences to apply to this schedule
Returns:
The Course scheduled
Throws:
EmptyCourseDatabaseException - if the "cdb" is empty
InstructorCanTeachNothingException - if no course exists for which the Instructor's preference is not a 0
InstructorWTUMaxedException - if no course exists which will not push an Instructor's WTU's past his/her limit
InstructorNotInDatabaseException - if, for some reason, the Instructor given isn't in the idb
NullInstructorException - if, for some reason, the given Instructor is null
CouldNotBeScheduledException - when no DaysAndTime object can be created for a given course, meaning it is to be TBA

alreadyLocked

private boolean alreadyLocked(Course c)
Used to find out whether a locked ScheduleItem contains a given course.

Parameters:
c - Course whose "locked-ness" is to be checked for
true - if one of the locked ScheduleItems contains "c"

decrementSectionCount

private void decrementSectionCount(Course c,
                                   java.util.Vector<Course> cdb)
Decrements a given Course's section count along w/ its lab's section count, if it has one. If the lecture's section count falls to 0, it is removed from the "cdb". Note the the provided Course "c" will not have its section count decremented directly. Rather, "c" is used to look itself up in "cdb", and the resulting object is decrememnted. This is done b/c, due to the possibility of a locked Course, the provided Course might already be part of a locked SI. Since we don't want to alter the SI in any way, we've got to be sure we only alter the section count of the Course in the CDB, which does not yet have a home.

Parameters:
c - Course to decrement section count
cdb - List of courses for generation

findCourse

private Course findCourse(java.util.Vector<Course> cdb,
                          java.util.Vector<Instructor> idb,
                          Instructor i)
                   throws EmptyCourseDatabaseException,
                          NullInstructorException,
                          InstructorNotInDatabaseException,
                          InstructorWTUMaxedException,
                          InstructorCanTeachNothingException
Finds the most suitable course for a given instructor to teach. In particular, the selected course will be whatever course for which the given instructor had the highest preference to teach. If he/she has the same highest preference for two courses, the first course encountered will be the one selected.

Parameters:
cdb - Database of courses
idb - Database of instructors
i - The instructor to select for
Returns:
The most ideal course to give this instructor. If this instructor cannot be assigned any more classes (i.e. maxed wtu's; no classes) available), null.
Throws:
EmptyCourseDatabaseException - if "cdb" is empty
NullInstructorException - if "i" is null
InstructorNotInDatabaseException - if, for some reason, "i" isn't in the "idb"
InstructorWTUMaxedException - if no course exists which will not push an Instructor's WTU's past his/her limit
InstructorCanTeachNothingException - if no course exists for which the Instructor's preference is not a 0

findCourseCheckPre

private void findCourseCheckPre(java.util.Vector cdb,
                                java.util.Vector idb,
                                Instructor i)
                         throws EmptyCourseDatabaseException,
                                NullInstructorException,
                                InstructorNotInDatabaseException,
                                InstructorWTUMaxedException,
                                InstructorCanTeachNothingException
Checks the preconditions for "findIdealCourse(...)" and throws appropriate exceptions.

Parameters:
cdb - The course database
idb - The instructor database
i - The instructor
Throws:
EmptyCourseDatabaseException - if "cdb" is empty
NullInstructorException - if "i" is null
InstructorNotInDatabaseException - if, for some reason, "i" isn't in the "idb"
InstructorWTUMaxedException - if no course exists which will not push an Instructor's WTU's past his/her limit
InstructorCanTeachNothingException - if no course exists for which the Instructor's preference is not a 0

findTime

private java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<DaysAndTime>> findTime(Instructor i,
                                                                 Course c)
                                                          throws CouldNotBeScheduledException
Compiles a list of all day/time combinations a given instructor can teach a given course. Takes into consideration both DaysForClasses preferences and NoClassOverlap preferences.

Parameters:
i - The Instructor
c - The Course
Returns:
A list of lists. Each entry in the first list represents a single day/time combination which worked. The first entry in the second list is for the lecture, while the second entry is for a possible lab.
Throws:
CouldNotBeScheduledException - when no DaysAndTime object can be created for a given course, meaning it is to be TBA

computeHalfHourLength

private java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer>> computeHalfHourLength(Course c)
Computes the number of half-hours slots a course can be taught over the school week. In particular, courses with labs are to be taught for their SCU - 1 hours. Courses w/o them are taught for their SCUs' worth of hours.

Parameters:
c - The course to be taught over the week
Returns:
A Vector of Vectors of Integers. Each first-level vector represents a given day-half-hour distribution. The first element of this vector if the number of days; the second, how many half-hours will fill each day.

hoursDivideIntoDaysWell

private boolean hoursDivideIntoDaysWell(int halfHours,
                                        int days)
Returns whether a number of half-hours can be evenly distributed over a given number of days in such a way that the course is taught for at least an hour every day.

Parameters:
halfHours - Number of half hours to distribute
days - Number of days to distribute the halfHours over
Returns:
(((halfHours % days) == 0) && ((halfHours / days) > 1))

createDATSForGivenTime

private java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<DaysAndTime>> createDATSForGivenTime(Instructor i,
                                                                               Course c,
                                                                               java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer> aDayCombo)
Creates a list of lists of possible DaysAndTime objects. Each first list representing DATs for a given number of days of the week. With each of these lists, the first DAT is for the lecture, and the second is for the lab, if one exists. A course's "DaysForClasses" preferences are taken into consideration here.

Parameters:
i - The instructor who to be scheduled for
c - The course to schedule
aDayCombo - Two-element vector. First element is how many days, second is number of half hours to be taught on each day
Returns:
A vector of vectors, each of which represents DATS which could be created for each DaysForClasses preference.

getAllDayCombos

private java.util.Vector<Week> getAllDayCombos(Course c,
                                               int numOfDays)
Given a number of days, returns a list of all weeks containing as many permutations of that numbers of days as are possible. Uses the course's DFC(s) to define the form of the week, though not necessarily the number of days.

Parameters:
c - Course with the course preferences to use
numOfDays - Number of days each Week should have
Returns:
a Vector of Week objects, each with "numOfDays" days.

chooseWhichDays

private Week chooseWhichDays(int depth,
                             Week availableDays,
                             Week alreadyAssigned)
                      throws NotEnoughDaysException
Chooses a number of days from a given Week of available days.

Parameters:
depth - Number of days to choose
availableDays - Days available to choose
alreadyAssigned - Days already in the Week to return
Returns:
A Week consisting of the days chosen from "availableDays". There will be exactly "depth" days in this Week.
Throws:
NotEnoughDaysException - if/when depth > availableDays.size()

computeInstructorTPrefsOverWeek

private java.util.Vector<Time> computeInstructorTPrefsOverWeek(Instructor i,
                                                               Week w)

makeDATList

private java.util.Vector<DaysAndTime> makeDATList(Course c,
                                                  Time s,
                                                  int halfHours,
                                                  Week w,
                                                  Instructor i)
Creates a list of acceptable DaysAndTime objects for a given Instructor's starting time preference. At most, this will return two DAT objects: the first for the lecture, and the second for the lab.

Parameters:
c - The course to make the DAT for. Used for checking for lab-ness
s - The starting time
halfHours - The number of half-hours after "s" the time should end
w - The Week of days to schedule over
i - The instructor, who must be available for all times assigned
Returns:
A list of DAT objects. The first will be for the course's lecture. If it has a lab, the second element in the list will be for said lab.

createDAT

private DaysAndTime createDAT(Course c,
                              Time s,
                              int halfHours,
                              Week days,
                              Instructor i)
Creates a DaysAndTime object for a given time range across a given Week for a given instructor. If the instructor is not available for this time, null is returned.

Parameters:
c - The course to be scheduling
s - The start time
halfHours - The number of half hours to go from "s"
days - The Week these times will be applied to
i - The instructor who needs to be available for this time span
Returns:
A DaysAndTime representing a time starting at "s", ending (halfHours * 30) minutes afterwards across "days". If "i" is not available for this time frame, null is returned.

doesNotOverlap

private boolean doesNotOverlap(Course c,
                               Time s,
                               Time e,
                               Week days)
Determines whether a given course's teaching time is to overlap that of another, already-scheduled course with which it is forbidden to overlap. If a given course isn't forbidden to overlap anything else, true is returned w/o question.

Parameters:
c - The course in question
s - The time the course is to start
e - The time the course is to end
days - The days over which the course is to be scheduled
Returns:
true if the Course doesn't overlap anything it should. False otherwise.

findLocation

private java.util.Vector<ScheduledLocation> findLocation(java.util.Vector<Location> ldb,
                                                         java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<DaysAndTime>> times,
                                                         Course c)
                                                  throws CouldNotBeScheduledException
Finds the location for a course and, if it has one, its labs.

Parameters:
ldb - List of locations to try
times - List of day/time combinations to try
c - The course to find a location for (contains its lab, if any).
Returns:
Location for a course and, if it has one, its lab. Lecture data is at index 0; lab data is at index 1
Throws:
CouldNotBeScheduledException - if TBA is given as the lecture's location.

findLoc

private ScheduledLocation findLoc(java.util.Vector<Location> ldb,
                                  DaysAndTime dat,
                                  Course c)
Finds a location for a given course, given a day/time to book.

Parameters:
ldb - List of locations to try
dat - Day/time combination to try
c - The course to put in the returned location.
Returns:
A ScheduledLocation object "c" can be taught in, or "TBA" if none was found.

createSI

private ScheduleItem createSI(Instructor i,
                              Course c,
                              ScheduledLocation l)
Creates a ScheduleItem. Note that the Course supplied to this method will be copied into the ScheduleItem (they'll be two completely separate objects).

Parameters:
i - The instructor
c - The course
l - The location and day/time pair
Returns:
A ScheduleItem containing the following data: 
       i                 - Instructor
       c                 - Course
       l.l               - Location
       c.getSection()    - Course section
       l.dat.week        - Days to schedule it
       l.dat.s           - Start time
       l.dat.e           - End time

add

public boolean add(ScheduleItem si)
Extends "add", so as to update schedule-related information as items are scheduled. Also enforced "no double booking" rules.

Parameters:
si - ScheduleItem to add
Returns:
true if the ScheduleItem was successfully added. False if it violated any rules (double booking, etc.)

verifyNoBadBookings

private boolean verifyNoBadBookings(ScheduleItem si)
Checks to ensure that no instructors, locations, or courses were booked innappropriately (double-booked, overlapped, etc.).

Parameters:
si - The ScheduleItem to verify
Returns:
true if no rules are violated. False otherwise.

check

private static boolean check(WeekAvail a,
                             Week days,
                             Time start,
                             Time end)
Checks whether a given hash of availability has a given span of free time.

Parameters:
a - Hash of availability
days - Days to consider for span of availability
start - Beginning of the given span of time
end - End of the given span of time
Returns:
true if the time span from "start" to "end" is free for all "days"

book

private static void book(WeekAvail a,
                         Week days,
                         Time start,
                         Time end)
Books a span of time over a set of days in a hash (indexed by numerical days) of availabilities.

Parameters:
a - Hash of availabilities
days - Set of days
start - Beginning of span of time
end - End of span of time

updateRecords

private void updateRecords(ScheduleItem si)
Updates the c, i, and l lists for a given schedule item, along with the instructor's "treatment".

Parameters:
si - The ScheduleItem containing all the information needed

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a String of the schedule. In reality, this just invokes the "toString" for every ScheduleItem contained in the schedule

replaceWithThisFromFile

public void replaceWithThisFromFile(Schedule s)
Replaces this schedule with a given one, while preserving this one's reference. All data (lists, TBAs, booking information, treatment, and the actual schedule) is passed over via shallow copies.

Parameters:
s - The schedule to replace this one with
